channel.name: Jar of TOBSCo (Hexaghost relic) - Daily Discussion 1 Oct

Next Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

__Votes__:
??? 3-Cost (Snecko card): 0

Daily Discussion 347/936

embeds.title: Jar of TOBSCo
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Start each combat with 1 **Intensity** :p_intensity:.
*A little extra heat makes everything better.*

messages.content: haha worse <data disc>

embeds.title: Data Disk
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Start each combat with 1 **Focus** :p_focus:.
*This disk contains precious data on birds and snakes.*

messages.content: actually pretty cool though, it's not a massive bonus but you definitely feel it in the inferno ghostflame, as well as crushing/bolstering too
searing gf (attack one) it rarely matters though.
the basic "start each combat with *character unique version of focus*"
good, trusty, a bit generic

Definitely not as strong as data disk as I said, but I'd also consider dd more in line with uncommons or rares. TOBSco you don't always really invest in gf's every run as much as you often do orbs on Defect.
There is an awful lot of room in the relic power range for "worse than data disk"! Maybe another baseline for comparison could be Vajra?
the numbers on ghost flames are about the same as on orbs so it should affect it equally
The defect easily triggers 3 orbs per turn without hardly trying, not even counting evoke, and I don't usually ignite 3 ghostflames every turn
Sometimes you can ignite a lot of times in one round but usually you get 1/2 a turn
God I wish I had data disk rn lmao
Would make this run easier
I forget, does it take 2 intensity to increase the strength bonus on the bolstering one? Or just 1
How tf do I beat act 3 with commons?
it doesnt change the str gain
only block
Igniting crushing gf is a multihit, and igniting inferno is an up to 6x increase.
Ah yes, thank you
<ghost shield>

embeds.title: Ghost Shield
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ethereal**. **Afterlife.**
Gain 7 (10) **Block** :p_block:.
When **Exhaust**ed,
gain 1 **Blur** :p_blur:.

messages.content: or try forcing an infinite as hard as you can
like double flash of steel degree of forcing
I mean you can't use mods
This is basegame
This relic adds like... 10 damage, 2 soulburn, and 1 block to <unlimited power>

embeds.title: Unlimited Power
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 4 (3) :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ignite** all Ghostflames in order.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: this is jar of tobsco discussion tho lol
True
Intensity isn't as good as focus
Hard to imagine the daily discussion ever going off topic
Do enjoy it tho for crushing
ikr
It happens a lot more than you think
Nothing is as good as focus though
I think intensity is better than potency though. Honestly the 1 potency relic feels pretty bad to get.
Fair
Except, like, ... intangible
<type=relic gain 1 potency>

embeds.title: Stone of Nomakk
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, gain 1 **Potency** :p_potency:.
*When presented to one of your Goop Gang, it seems to make the blob dance.*

messages.content: Potency is fine in command but I wish it was 2
this is like, really not good tbh
Yeah I think it should be 2 and changed to uncommon.
at most its like +3 dmg from your slimes

the real question:
nomakk stone or boot?
Potency can matter more if you have specialists
More than usual, I mean
There isn't evoking like there is on orbs, there isn't extra slime slots like there are orb slots, it doesn't even effect the secondary effect of slimes.
dont most specialists need 2 potency to actually do something other than +1 dmg
Yes
Potency doesn't really even matter on specialists unless you have 2+
Yes
But you need 1 to get to 2
It combos well with <level up> though

embeds.title: Level Up
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 1 (2) **Potency** :p_potency:.

messages.content: This unexpected strategy tip brought to you by the integers
no, every other source in the game (can) give 2
Makes it not need to be upgraded
Yeah, I mean, I'm not buying Stone of Nomakk from the shop or anything, but it can work with a <Liquidate> to hit the next threshold, I don't think it's down in The Boot territory

embeds.title: Liquidate
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Unplayable** if you have negative **Strength** :p_strength:.
Lose 2 **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 2 (3) **Potency** :p_potency:.

messages.content: liquidate is really good if you have decent strengh gain and absorb
It can definitely anchor a deck, in unusual circumstances
Especially now that Split no longer exhausts so you have strength scaling built in for the long run, if your deck is small
split tbh is like the worst infinite scaling card
not saying its a bad card
but using it for infinite strengh scaling is bad
I'm just as fond of this relic as I am of data disk.
It has a little bit extra immediate effect for being slower in the long term (with the exception of the inferno).
On average, a really good hexaghost deck will get 2-3 ignites per turn.
Compare to defect who starts with 1 orb turn 1 but gets 3, up to ten.
though data disc helps with block this is like, +1 block sometimes
It's definitely better than stone of nomak though.
this server if ghost shield didnt exist
Well yeah the point is that it does a little bit more than data disk early in the fight and becomes a little bit less after turn 3ish.
trying to make potency builds:
stone of nomak was better as a rare relic that gave 2 potency.
1 potency is insanely boring
1 potency is 0 potency practically speaking
one is none two is one
you dont get draw, you dont get faster scaling, you get nothing with only 1 point
Oh right.
It's also worth saying that while focus is better than intensity, hexaghost has multiple sources of intensity while defect only has 2 cards and one relic.
And a potion, I guess.
haters (sts devs) cant stand a bad bitch (defect) winning (having more than 1 focus and becoming op)
why is it that dailies neverstick on topic
oh yeah what was this about again
isnt it 3?
consume
defrag, biased and <lose orb slot gain focus>

allocate 😔

OP as shit

I'm still thinking about axe kick
what?
0 cost deal damage evoke current orb I think?
there a lot of cool ideas in removed content
nova which was blizzard but for powers
what do yall think of reprive
defect has a lot of cool concepts but ends up being miserable on high ascension
tbh im confused on how lock on is its own keyword
definitely not that bad, but still not great. Would say it needs a buff, but boot just fucking sucks.
they didnt have enough space on the card maybe?

kinda wish they kept that

deal 8 dmg
orbs deal +50% dmg to the targeted enemy
for 2 (3) turns

<judgement> <bullseye>

embeds.title: Judgment
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :purple_energy: / The Watcher / Slay the Spire

If the enemy has 30 (40) or less HP, set their
HP to 0.

embeds.title: Bullseye
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Deal 8 (11) damage.
Apply 2 (3) Lock-On.

messages.content: judgement text is longer

It's certainly a net positive to find this, it's at it's best when you can trigger the crushing ghostflames pretty consistently, as the multihit works well with intensity. I would usually consider buying this from a shop if my deck was capable of igniting 1-2 ghostflames average each turn. It's only a common, and I think it gives plenty of reasonable benefits for being that rarity. Usually fairly happy to get this as a random drop, since you will nearly always be using ghostflames to some extent as hexaghost, and can expect some extra damage from this.
